description:
INTERPOLATE IMAGE FROM PLANE THROUGH VOLUME.

NOTE: If you want to generate an image with all of the capabilities of the GUI rendering, see -show-scene.

Renders an image of an arbitrary plane through the volume file, with a simple linear grayscale palette.  The parameter <interp> must be one of:

CUBIC
ENCLOSING_VOXEL
TRILINEAR

volume.description: the volume file to interpolate from

subvolume.description: the name or number of the subvolume to use

h-dim.description: width of output image, in pixels

v-dim.description: height of output image, in pixels

bottom-left-x.description: x-coordinate of the bottom left of the output image

bottom-left-y.description: y-coordinate of the bottom left of the output image

bottom-left-z.description: z-coordinate of the bottom left of the output image

bottom-right-x.description: x-coordinate of the bottom right of the output image

bottom-right-y.description: y-coordinate of the bottom right of the output image

bottom-right-z.description: z-coordinate of the bottom right of the output image

top-left-x.description: x-coordinate of the top left of the output image

top-left-y.description: y-coordinate of the top left of the output image

top-left-z.description: z-coordinate of the top left of the output image
